text: Search this document: With Development Toolkit (DTK) you can develop plugins in Java that you then incorporate into the system. Note! While this document does not include general information about Java programming, it contains rules and recommendations you should follow to operate your new plugin with the system. This document contains an overview of the classes and interfaces used for the different plugins. For a complete list of all the classes, and the full syntax details, see the Javadoc, which can be found in the unzipped devkit_<version>.zip file, under <devkit_dir>/javadoc when DTK has been installed according to Installation and Setup . In the DTK package, examples of full-featured plugins are also included. You are encouraged to examine these examples that can be found in unzipped devkit_<version>.zip file, under <devkit_dir>/examples. The following chapters and sections are included: Development Toolkit Overview Creating a DTK Plugin Agent Plugins Installation and Setup Data Serialization Exceptions UDR Plugins Event Plugins APL Plugins Ultra Field Plugins Notifier Plugins Workflow Service Plugins Environment Interfaces Configuration Contract Documentation for Agent Plugins Agent Plugin Examples
title: Development Toolkit User's Guide - MediationZone Documentation 9.4 - InfoZone
